about_the_game:
In Network Engineer Simulator you are hired to do the unenviable job of cleaning up data closets. You will visit various locations from small closets to large data centers where you will need to untangle and organize these server racks and ensure various services are operational. Your goal is to beautify these closets and make sure the company remains operational. Remember, it’s always the network’s fault.

The brains behind Network Engineer Simulator involve real professional Network Engineers and Architects to ensure the game offers a realistic but fun experience!

Key Features:

Diverse Game Modes: You can just focus on untangling and organizing cables or you can up the difficulty and learn some basic functionalities of networking.

Realistic cables: Managing, organizing and routing cables through racks and patch panels will make it feel like you’re actually cabling.

Interfacing with different types of hardware: Switches, Routers, Firewalls, Servers and much more!

Learn basic networking: Navigate and learn how networking actually operates in the real world!

Upcoming Features: Stay tuned for updates during development!

name: Network Engineer Simulator

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 10
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia 10xx or similar graphics card
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 10 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: 11
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia 20xx or better, or similar graphics card
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 20 GB available space

You will visit various locations from small closets to large data centers where you will need to untangle and organize these server racks and ensure various services are operational.
